sample

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The controller of the program, which handles the different events that will happen, when the user interacts with the GUI.

        Parameters:
        listView - the list of playlist //(showPlaylist)

      • handlePlaylistMouseExited

        public void handlePlaylistMouseExited()
        Handler for when the user mouse is exiting the playlist listview. This method exists to prevent an annoyance which occurs, when the user clicks an existing playlist and then clicks somewhere else in the gui. At this point if the user selects the same playlist, it will start editing the name, which in most cases is not the intention.

      • handleSearch

        public void handleSearch(javafx.event.Event e)
        Handles the search text field. The type of search is determined by a combobox showing a specific criteria.
        Parameters:
        e - the event passed to the search

      • startSearch

        public void startSearch(javafx.event.Event e,
                        java.lang.String criteria)
        Handles the event from the search text field and queries the database with a specified criteria. Updates the listviewSong with the songs matching the search criteria.
        Parameters:
        e - the event passed to the search
        criteria - criteria for the search

      • handleSongListInfo

        Returns:
